sen.j: 嵐山駅（あらしやまえき）は、京都市西京区嵐山東一川町7にある、阪急電鉄阪急嵐山線の終着駅である。
sen.e: Arashiyama Station (Arashiyama-eki) is the terminal of Hankyu Railway's Hankyu Arashiyama Line in 7 Arashiyama Higashi Ichikawa-cho, Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Arashiyama Station (Arashiyama-eki), located at 7 Arashiyama Higashi Ichikawa-cho, Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City, is the terminal of Hankyu Railway's Hankyu Arashiyama Line.
Arashiyama Station, located at 7 Arashiyama Higashi Ichikawa-cho, Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City, is the terminal of Hankyu Arashiyama Line, which is operated by Hankyu Railway.

sen.j: 京都を代表する観光地の一つ嵐山への大阪・神戸方面からの玄関口である。
sen.e: It is the gateway from Osaka and Kobe to Arashiyama, one of the representative tourist spots of Kyoto.
It's the gateway from Osaka and Kobe to Arashiyama, one of the representative tourist spots of Kyoto.
It's the gateway from Osaka and Kobe to Arashiyama, one of the representative tourist spots of Kyoto.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: The Structure of the Station
The Structure of the Station
Station layout

sen.j: かつては頭端式ホーム6面5線のホームであったが、現在は3面2線に縮小され、使用されていないホームには植樹がなされている。
sen.e: In the past, the station had a toothed platform with six sides and five railway lines, but today it has been reduced to three sides with two railway lines, and trees have planted on the platforms that are no longer in use.

Formerly, the station had a toothed platform with six sides and five railway lines, but today it has three sides with two railway lines, and trees have planted on the platforms that are no longer in use.
Formerly, the station had six toothed platforms serving five tracks, but today it has three platforms with two tracks, and trees have been planted on the platforms that are no longer in use.
sen.cmt: 頭端式ホーム6面5線のホーム→six toothed platforms serving five tracks としました。

sen.j: 通常は中央のホームのみ使用するが、行楽期には両外側のホームを降車専用として使う。
sen.e: Usually on the central plaform is being used, but in the holiday season, the platforms at the outer sides are used only for unboarding the train.
Usually, just the central platform is used, but in the holiday season the platforms at the outer sides are used for passengers leaving the trains.
Usually, just the central platform is used, but in the holiday season the platforms at the outer sides are used for passengers leaving the trains.

sen.j: この降車専用ホームからは上りスロープと下り階段により改札（上写真右端）へと通じているが、通年使用されている改札口（上写真中央付近）に行く通路はない。
sen.e: From this platform reserved for getting off trains one reacheds the ticket wicket (righthand side of the photo above) by an upward slope and and descending stairs, but there is no passage to the ticket wicket used all-year-round (center of the picture above)

From this platform, which is reserved for getting off trains one reaches the ticket wicket (the right-hand side in the above photo) by an upward slope and descending stairs, but there is no passage to the ticket wicket used all year round (center in the above picture)

From this platform, which is reserved for getting off trains, one reaches the ticket gate (the right-hand side in the above photograph) by an upward slope and descending stairs, but there is no passage to the ticket gate used all year round (center in the above picture).
sen.cmt: ticket gateとしました。ピリオドを追加しました。"photo"→"photograph"に変更しました。

sen.j: また、1号線は展示などのイベントに使用されることがある。
sen.e: Also railway line No. 1 is sometimes used for exhibitions, etc.
Also, railway line No. 1 is sometimes used for exhibitions, etc.
Also, track No. 1 is sometimes used for exhibitions, etc.

sen.j: 駅名標には「嵐山」の下に括弧付きで「（嵯峨野）」と記されている。
sen.e: There is “(Sagano)” written in brackets under “Arashiyama” on the sign of the station.
“Sagano,” written in brackets, is shown under “Arashiyama” on the station sign.
(Sagano),' written in brackets, is shown under 'Arashiyama' on the station sign.
sen.cmt: 二バイト文字を修正しました。

sen.j: また、方面案内標識には「京都（河原町）」と記されているが、ここでいう「京都」は京都駅や京都市のことではなく、いわゆる洛中（らくちゅう、概ね旧平安京内部）のことである。
sen.e: Also, on the signs informing on the direction of the trains, “Kyoto (Kawaramachi)” is written, but this “Kyoto” does not refer to Kyoto Station or Kyoto City, but to Rakuchu, i.e. the inner area of the former Heian-kyo (capital of Japan in the Heian period).

Also, on the signs indicating the direction of the trains, “Kyoto (Kawaramachi)” is written, but this “Kyoto” doesn't refer to Kyoto Station or Kyoto City but to Rakuchu, i.e., the inner area of the former Heian-kyo (capital of Japan in the Heian period).

Also, on the signs indicating the direction of the trains, 'Kyoto (Kawaramachi)' is written, but this 'Kyoto' doesn't refer to Kyoto Station or Kyoto City but to Rakuchu, i.e., the inner area of the former Heian-kyo (capital of Japan in the Heian period).
sen.cmt: 二バイト文字を修正しました。

sen.j: 古めかしい駅舎が今もなお健在である。
sen.e: The old station hall is still in good shape even today.
The old station hall is still in good shape even today.
The old station building is still in good shape even today.
sen.cmt: 駅舎→station building として統一しています。

sen.j: 土休日は1号線を、平日は2号線を使用する。
sen.e: On Saturdays and Holidays railway line No. 1 is used, on weekdays railway line No. 2.
On Saturdays and holidays, railway line No. 1 is used, and on weekdays railway line No. 2 is used.
On Saturdays and holidays, track No. 1 is used, and on weekdays track No. 2 is used.

sen.j: また、イベントなどは1号線で実施する。
sen.e: Events take place on railway line No. 1.
Events take place on railway line No. 1.
Events take place on railway line No. 1.

sen.j: 平成15年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約3,395人（京都府統計書より）。
sen.e: According to the statistics of Kyoto Prefecture, the number of passangers per day in fiscal 2003 was about 3,395.
According to the statistics of Kyoto Prefecture, the number of passengers per day in fiscal 2003 was approximately 3,395.
The number of passengers per day in fiscal year 2003 was approximately 3,395 (according to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report).
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。fiscal → fiscal yearに変更しました。

tit.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 周辺は住宅地。
sen.e: The surrounding area is a residential district.
The surrounding area is a residential district.
The surrounding area is a residential district.

sen.j: 嵐山の観光地は駅から北西の方向にあたる。
sen.e: The touristic attraction of Arashiyama are in Northwestern direction of the station.
The touristic attractions of Arashiyama are in the northwestern direction from the station.
The touristic attractions of Arashiyama are in the northwestern direction from the station.

sen.j: 渡月橋まで約400m。
sen.e: About 400m to Togetsu-kyo Bridge
Approximately 400 m to Togetsu-kyo Bridge
Approximately 400 m to Togetsu-kyo Bridge

sen.j: 京福電気鉄道嵐山駅 (京福電気鉄道)は渡月橋を渡って徒歩約10分。
sen.e: A ten minute walk to Arashiyama station Keifuku Electric Railroad Co.,Ltd.) crossing Togetsu-kyo Bridge.
It's a ten-minute walk to Arashiyama station Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.), across Togetsu-kyo Bridge.
It's a ten-minute walk to Arashiyama Station (Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.), across Togetsu-kyo Bridge.

sen.j: さらに北へ行くと、西日本旅客鉄道嵯峨嵐山駅、嵯峨野観光鉄道トロッコ嵯峨駅などがある（ただし徒歩で30分程度掛かるため乗り換えに利用する際には注意が必要）。
sen.e: If one walks even further North one reaches the Saga-Arashiyama Station of West Japan Railway Company and the Saga Torokko station of Sagano Scenic Railway (however, it takes about 30 minutes to walk, so one has to be careful when using these stations for changing trains).

Walking even farther north, one reaches the Saga-Arashiyama Station of the West Japan Railway Company and the Saga Torokko station of the Sagano Scenic Railway (however, it takes about 30 minutes to walk, so one has to be careful when using these stations to change trains).

Walking even farther north, one reaches the Saga-Arashiyama Station of the West Japan Railway Company and the Saga Torokko Station of the Sagano Scenic Railway (however, it takes about thirty minutes to walk, so one has to be careful when using these stations to change trains).
sen.cmt: Station を大文字から始めました。数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: ミニストップ
sen.e: Ministop
Mini-stop
Mini-stop

sen.j: 京都嵐山郵便局
sen.e: Kyoto Arashiyama Post Office
Kyoto Arashiyama Post Office
The Kyoto Arashiyama post office
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 京都市立嵐山東小学校
sen.e: Arashiyama Higashi Elementary School, Kyoto City
Arashiyama Higashi Elementary School, Kyoto City
Arashiyama Higashi Elementary School, Kyoto City

sen.j: 桂川 (淀川水系)
sen.e: Katsura-gawa River (part of river system of the Yodo-gawa River)
The Katsura-gawa River (part of the Yodo-gawa River system)
The Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system)
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 京都府道29号宇多野嵐山山田線
sen.e: Kyoto prefectural road No.29 Utano Arashiyama Yamada Route
Kyoto Prefectural Road No. 29, Utano Arashiyama Yamada Route
Utano Arashiyama Yamada Line of the Kyoto Prefectural Route 29
sen.cmt: 道路の表現を変更しました。

tit.cmt: 小タイトル用に小文字にしました。

sen.j: 阪急嵐山駅前
sen.e: In front of Arashiyama Station (Hankyu Railway)
In front of Arashiyama Station (Hankyu Railway)
In front of Arashiyama Station (Hankyu Railway)

sen.j: 京都市営バス
sen.e: Kyoto City Bus
Kyoto City Bus
Kyoto City Bus

sen.j: 28系統：（四条大宮経由）京都駅行
sen.e: Route 28: Bound for Kyoto Sta. via Shijo Omiya
Route 28: Bound for Kyoto Station via Shijo Omiya
Route 28: Bound for Kyoto Station via Shijo Omiya

sen.j: 28系統：大覚寺行
sen.e: Route 28: Bound for Daikakuji Temple
Route 28: Bound for Daikakuji Temple
Route 28: Bound for Daikaku-ji Temple

sen.j: 京都バス
sen.e: Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd.
Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd.
Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 嵐山観光の客を見込んで、当初は6面5線という巨大なターミナル駅として建設された。
sen.e: Anticipating large numbers of guests because of Arashiyama sightseeing, the station at first was built as huge terminal station with 5 railway lines and 6 sides.
Originally, in anticipation of large numbers of Arashiyama sightseers, the station was built as a huge terminal station with five railway lines and six sides.
Originally, in anticipation of large numbers of Arashiyama sightseers, the station was built as a huge terminal station with six platforms with five tracks.
sen.cmt: 6面5線→six platforms with five tracks としました。

sen.j: しかし乗客がさほどいなかったことから、戦後に3面2線へ縮小した。
sen.e: However, as there were not so many guests, the size was reduced to three sides and 2 railway lines.
However, the passenger traffic was less than expected, so the size was reduced to three sides and two railway lines.
However, the passenger traffic was less than expected, so the size was reduced to three platforms with two tracks.
sen.cmt: 3面2線→three platforms with two tracks としました。

sen.j: 今も東側にホーム跡がある。
sen.e: Today one can still see the remains of the platforms at the Eastern side,
Today one can still see the remains of the platforms on the eastern side.
Today one can still see the remains of the platforms on the eastern side.

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月9日 新京阪鉄道嵐山線開通と同時に開業。
sen.e: On November 9th 1928, the Station began its operation at the same time as the Shinkeihan Railway Arashiyama Line.
November 9, 1928: The station went into operation concurrently with the Shinkeihan Railway Arashiyama Line.
November 9, 1928: The station went into operation concurrently with the Shinkeihan Railway Arashiyama Line.

sen.j: 1930年（昭和5年）9月15日 会社合併により、京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: On September 15th 1930, due to company mergers, it became a station of Keihan Electric Railway.
On September 15, 1930, it became a station of Keihan Electric Railway due to company mergers.
September 15, 1930: It became a station of Keihan Electric Railway as a result of amalgamation.
sen.cmt: 会社合併→as a result of amalgamation として統一しました。

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 京阪電気鉄道と阪神急行電鉄との合併により、京阪神急行電鉄（のちの阪急電鉄）の駅となる。
sen.e: On October 1st 1943, due to company mergers, it became a station of Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway),
On October 1, 1943, it became a station of Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway) due to company mergers.
October 1, 1943: It became a station of Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway)as a result of amalgamation between Keihan Electric Railway and Hanshin Electric Express Railway.

sen.j: 1944年（昭和19年）1月9日 資材供出のため全線単線化。
sen.e: On January 9th 1944, all the railway lines became single, because of the need to supply materials.
January 9, 1944: All the railway lines became single due to the need to supply materials.
January 9, 1944: All the railway lines became single due to the need to supply materials.

tit.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 第2回近畿の駅百選に選定されている。
sen.e: It was selected for the second selection of 100 famous stations in the Kinki region.
It was part of the second selection of 100 famous stations in the Kinki region.
The station was chosen as part of the second selection of 100 prominent stations in the Kinki region.
sen.cmt: 近畿の駅百選 の表現を変更しました。

tit.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 阪急電鉄
sen.e: Hankyu Railway/Hankyu Corporation
Hankyu Railway (Hankyu Corporation)
Hankyu Railway
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: ■嵐山線
sen.e: Arashiyama Line
Arashiyama Line
Arashiyama Line

sen.j: 松尾駅 (京都府) - 嵐山駅
sen.e: Matsuo Station – Arashiyama Station (Hankyu Railway)
Matsuo Station – Arashiyama Station (Hankyu Railway)
Matsuo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) – Arashiyama Station (Hankyu Railway)
